Sec. 8A-302. Security requirements.
Each convenience store as defined above shall:
Be equipped with the following security devices:
A silent alarm that notifies local law enforcement or a private security agency that a robbery is taking place.
A security camera system capable of retrieving an image to assist in the identification and apprehension of a robber.
A drop safe or cash management device that provides minimum access to the facility's cash receipts.
Lighted parking lots illuminated at an intensity of two (2) footcandles per square foot with a uniformity ratio of no more than five to one (5:1) at eighteen (18) inches above the surface.
Post a conspicuous sign in the convenience store entrance which states that the cash register contains fifty dollars ($50.00) or less.
Maintain window signage so that there is a clear and unobstructed view of the cash register and transaction area.
Prohibit window tinting on the windows of the establishment if such tinting reduces exterior or interior viewing during the hours of operation to which this act is applicable.
Install height markers at the entrance of the establishment which display height measures from the floor.
Establish a cash management policy to limit the amount of available cash on hand between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m.
